intro: Hieracium tenellifolium, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads made up of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster. It is known for its ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes, making it a common weed in agricultural areas.
